greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = Sum_{k=1..n} 2^bigomega(k).
comment: Partial sums of A061142. - _Michel Marcus_, Aug 08 2017
reference: G. Tenenbaum and Jie Wu, Cours Spécialisés No. 2: "Théorie analytique et probabiliste des nombres", Collection SMF, Ordres moyens, p. 20.
G. Tenenbaum, Introduction to analytic and probabilistic number theory, Cambridge University Press, 1995, p. 53, exercise 5 (in the third edition 2015, p. 59, exercise 57).
link: Michel Marcus, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
formula: Asymptotic formula: a(n) = 1/(8*log(2))*C*n*log(n)^2+O(n*log(n)) with C = A167864 = prod((1+1/p/(p-2)) where the product is over all the primes p>2. [Typo corrected by _Vaclav Kotesovec_, May 23 2020]
a(n) = 1 + Sum_{k=1..floor(log_2(n))} 2^k * pi_k(n), where pi_k(n) is the number of k-almost primes <= n. (End)
results.author: _Benoit Cloitre_, Apr 14 2002
